Derya,

The Python interface uses an old version of class Reactor that requires
either P or V to be constant. It doesn't implement the methods that you
are trying to use. I'll take a look at upgrading it to the new Reactor
class over the next few days.

By the way, I have made some significant changes in C++. The most
visible change is that class 'CKGas' is replaced by class 'IdealGasMix'.
Also, there is support now for XML reaction mechanism input files, and a
fast, hard-wired class implementing GRI-Mech 3.0. The latest version is
documented at http://blue.caltech.edu/ctdoc. I will have a new source
distribution ready that is consistent with this documentation within a
day or two.

Dave

 

-----Original Message-----
From: Derya Ozyurt [mailto:derya_oz@...] 
Sent: Friday, April 05, 2002 12:38 PM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] Reactor methods


Dear All;
Can someone help me out to use methods like
setInitialVolume, setVDotCoeff or initialize.

reactor = Cantera.Reactor(reactor_type)
1. reactor.initialize
2. reactor.setInitialVolume(vol)
3. reactor.setVDotCoeff(K)

All these three above give the same error like

C:\WINDOWS\Desktop\NOx>c:\python21\python noxsim2.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "noxsim2.py", line 163, in ?
    reactor.setInitialVolume(vol)
AttributeError: setInitialVolume


Thank you for your help in advance.
Cheers
Derya
